basics.name: Mohammed Ali Cheddad
basics.label: Software & Systems Engineer | UAV Control Researcher
basics.summary: Systems & Automation Engineer at Oracle with a strong background in Linux QA, embedded systems, robotics and AI-driven control for UAVs.

work.name: Oracle
work.summary: Automating QA pipelines for Oracle Linux, integrating AI-based log triage and optimizing test resource usage.
highlights: Reduced destructive test time from 3 days to 7 hours
Automated on-demand cluster provisioning and replaced persistent clusters
Refactored QA test suites for better logging and triage
Built LLM-based RAG/MCP pipeline for issue triage

work.name: Oracle
work.summary: Intern role focusing on OpenSCAP automation, CVE detection, and log analysis scripting to strengthen OS baseline security.
highlights: Implemented OpenSCAP scans and vulnerability workflows
Developed log-analysis scripts reducing debugging time for QA team

work.name: Intelcia IT Solutions
work.summary: Proof of Concept deployment for Fortinet SD-WAN to improve network resilience and security.
highlights: Managed deployment and configuration of SD-WAN solution

projects.name: Autonomous UAV Controller
projects.summary: Designed a nonlinear backstepping controller on SE(3) for UAV thrust/torque control in PX4 + ROS2 simulation.

projects.name: Oracle Explain AI Log Triage
projects.summary: Developed a pipeline using RAG/MCP techniques and LLMs to automate log‐analysis and issue triage for Oracle Linux QA.

projects.name: Network IDS using ML/DL
projects.summary: Built a deep‐learning based network intrusion detection system and open‐source repository for research.

projects.name: Autonomous Car (Raspberry Pi)
projects.summary: Computer‑vision navigation with OpenCV and deep learning for competition.

projects.name: Network Scanner GUI
projects.summary: Python + Scapy + Nmap tool with ReportLab report generation.
